Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: i_love_travelling797
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect We didn't use any transport, and just walked to the main sights. They upgraded our room as a compliment, and we had a much larger room than we excpected! The room was nice, clean and spacious. It was well equipped, we had everything we needed. The bed was of a big size! Free WiFi worked well. The staff were friendly and helping. All in all, we had a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice centrally located hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: PDM82
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights as a surprise for my husbands birthday. Hotel is very central and all the main sights from palace to prado museum can be reached on foot. Althought underground is also very close by which we used for getting to football grounds and bull ring etc. There are bars and restaurants all around with endless choices, we especially enjoyed tapas at Lateral located in plaza santa ana right next to the hotel,it was very good value. The restaurant attached to the hotel does great cocktails if your willing to pay a little extra. The hotel room itself was very nicely decorated with lovely finishing touches, lots of toiletries provided. The bed was huge, much larger than a UK king size! Nice bathroom and desk area which had windows opening to the inner court yard. This meant we had an internal room which I believe meant it was quieter than if located on outside. We were above the gym which meant we could hear people on the treadmill! Overall great hotel and very accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Well done, well located Poperty”
Reviews.Author: John1164
Reviews.Content: Wife and two small children stayed here in November 2011. Excellent location in MAdrid - close to everything yet tucked away in a desirable part of Madrd. We had the jun ior suite, which was very spacious, and very clean. Hardwood floors throughout, clean, well kept bathrooms and excellent service (5 star service, withouth feeling like they are on top of you). I would stay here again when i return to Madrd. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place, but room was a little claustrophobic.”
Reviews.Author: azoomi
Reviews.Content: Our room was called the "superior" room but it felt pretty basic plus the slanted ceiling which offered no view was weird. It was over 300 bucks a night which I know in contrast to NYC is a steal but still didn't feel like the bargain it looked like online. The service was good and the people working there were very very good so I guess I would recommend it. The location was central but in a very very busy part of town. I had never been to Madrid and was hoping it would be a little more charming area than it was, but all things considered, a pretty good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “PALACIO DE TEPA .....MADRID”
Reviews.Author: michael187432
Reviews.Content: We travelled to MADRID by AVE from MALAGA which was an interesting experience in itself...very efficient and very fast.....only two and a half hours. An upgrade to club is justified. Our stay at the PALACIO DE TEPA was excellent and we would certainly recommend it. Perfect location with extremely helpful and friendly service. I would like to praise , in particular , the Guest Relations Manager who was able to give us all the information we required which is so vital in any city if you are to really enjoy it. We do have experience of NH HOTELS especially their establishment in Sotogrande so we knew what level service to expect and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “palacio de tepa”
Reviews.Author: TucsonJoanne
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for four nights and it was wonderful. excellent service, excellent location and quiet .room. we had a deluxe room on the 5th floor w a slanted window on the ceiling. the room was large and comfortable but felt a bit clostophobic only being able to see the sky. but i would defintely recommend this hotel. very reasonable as well

Reviews.Title: “Central yet quiet”
Reviews.Author: malvern09
Reviews.Content: A lovely comfortable hotel, in a brilliant location - just up the hill (10-15 minutes walk, or a couple of metro stops) from the three famous art museums, just around the corner from Plaza Santa Anna, and a few minutes walk from Plaza Mayor and Sol, with all the opportunities for sight-seeing and retail therapy. Most things walkable, though those hills seem awfully long and steep after a long day tramping round museums! Our room was beautifully appointed (though a little on the compact side for a 5* hotel) and the bed huge. Staff were friendly, and breakfast in the hotel restaurant was very nice (though not cheap!) - usual good cold buffet, plus omlettes etc cooked to order. Got an excellent deal through Expedia (don't normally splash out on 5*!) - though prices probably reflect the perilous state of the Spanish economy, and the fact that this seems more like a '4* boutique' hotel than a traditional 'grand' 5*. Look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quality throughout but it doesnt quite come together.”
Reviews.Author: Alan J
Reviews.Content: Stunning building and some interesting use of space inside - Great to look at. Well equipped, everything worked, the staff were nice and friendly and it's as good a location as you will get in central Madrid. Somehow it didn't all fit together and instead of feeling torn between staying in or going out I always chose to go out.

Reviews.Title: “An excellant city centre hotel !”
Reviews.Author: welshgirlNetherlands
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem for a city centre. Its central location makes it an excellant choice for visting all of the important attractions but it is also quiet and away from traffic noise. The hotel is beautifully decorated and very welcoming. Our room was spacious, very clean and had a lovely view across to the church. It was well equipped with an excellant choice of toiletries, tea and coffee making facilities as well as a complimentary mini-bar. The breakfast was 1st class with one of the widest choice of selections that I have ever experienced. The staff were both friendly and helpful. Overall for the price I would most definately recommend this as a place to stay for a trip to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quality accommodation, & very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GretaFalls
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Palacio de Tepa for a weekend followed by some business. The central location was brilliant - right next to Plaza Santa Anna & a 5 min walk to Plaza Mayor. The room was very comfortable with very good facilities. We had one overlooking the well which ensured for a quiet night. It was on the small side but had a separate small room with a desk. The staff were unfailingly helpful. Would certainly recommend it & stay there again. One small gripe - not hotel 's fault - but airport taxi driver didn't know where it was because it was so new.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, good service, central location”
Reviews.Author: Oscar R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Palacio de Tepa for five nights in mid February. Our junior suite was on a single level and very spacious. The bathroom was well equipped with lovely Bvlgari toiletries and a plentiful supply of soft large towels. Wifi worked well and the staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel is well placed to walk to the three large art galleries and the main sites in central Madrid. Certainly the best hotel we've experienced in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vivek_Neelam
Reviews.Content: As part of my business trip I stayed at the Hotel for One Night (16/2) and indeed it is a beautiful hotel more from inside than outside. The reception lobby, restaurant and rooms were very good. We got a room at First Floor and our colleagues got at the top floor. Both the rooms were very elegantly designed and provided with all requisite infrastructure for a comfortable stay. Our room opened in to a window on the street whereas the room at the top had wooden ceiling with a window to open towards the sky. The best part was the view of the sky being reflected from the glass ceiling over the reception area. Movement of clouds gave illusion of we moving in sky. It was very beautiful. Last but not the least, the staff at the reception were courteous and very helpful in a city where there was language problem. Also the city of Madrid provided an architectural magnificience in form of the various statues and Royal Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,but rooms re small.”
Reviews.Author: 1234ch
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to everything. Great Jazz music next door.Food good there too. Breakfast very expensive. Clean. Rooms smaller than they appear on net.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL: location, service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Khangela
Reviews.Content: This wonderful boutique hotel is truly deserving 5 stars : absolutely flawless in every way ! The design of the hotel interior is impressive and stylish. NH Palacio de Tepa is a comfortable city centre hotel, in a great location for sightseeing and nightlife. Staff is really pleasant and very attentive. The hotel is spotless clean, everywhere ! Breakfast is a feast, never before seen such a great presentation of a breakfast. NH Palacio de Tepa offers free WiFi throughout the hotel, however one has to pay for using the computer in the business centre (€5 for 15 minutes). I had room 516 in the far end corner of the top floor, direct under the sloping roof with large beams. For tall people this feels a bit uncomfortable. Rooms are equipped with coffee- and tea making facilities, a safe, minibar and enough space to store your clothes. Bathroom is well equipped, no defects found, equipped with a rain-shower. The bathtub however is rather small. The hotel is in 50 meters from the lively Plaza Santa Anna, where one can find many tapas bars and restaurants. It is only 10 minutes walk to Plaza Mayor, and even less than 10 minutes to the Prado Museum and Retiro Park. All in all an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and great as a business or leisure hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravel20
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here 3 times now I don't really understand some of the complaints... If you take a room on the 5th floor the rooms are spacious, well equipped for business travellers and very new, modern and clean. In fact for a business hotel it's extremely well appointed right down to the details of pillow choice, free wifi, great breakfast, gym great room service and really not expensive... I had a blissful nights sleep there on wednesday night and will undoubtedly return very soon...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Spuderini
Reviews.Content: A very friendly and helpful group of staff. Near a couple of train stations painless transition from airport to hotel. It took about 30 mins. Beautiful rooms and bathroom. Not the largest but more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lienete
Reviews.Content: We were for New Year celebration in Madrid and stayed in this hotel. They placed us in the room as we preferred, on higher floor (to have less noise from the streets) and windows to face front side. Only thing is really bothered me, that the mattress was way too hard for my liking, actually first two night I could hardly sleep it felt like I am laying on planks of wood. So I guess you may have a hard bed in B&B or in 5star hotel. I really didn't expect that. Everything close by, Puerta Del Sol and Mayor square. Christmas market, lots of shops around. But I would say it is a bit "off area" for 5 star hotel. So it didn't really work to enjoy whole together experience. It was special "new year" treat for us, but if staying in 5 start hotel, I would prefer to be in area of Prado museum or Grand Via. Now I know. Service and hotel staff's attitude was impeccable. All in all Madrid fun city, but it rather party/shopping experience as it has no as much to offer as other European capitals like London, Paris, Rome. It has been also incredibly busy, busier than any other European capitals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: me-gva
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel just off Santa Ana and close to lots of very nice restaurants and tapa bars. A great location especially when you are tired in the evening and do not want to take a taxi to have dinner. This hotel allows you to walk out and have a great selection of every type of food. The service was excellent -- very nice and helpful. The room impeccable and very comfortable. Definitely would go again. it is a bit pricey -- but no complaints. large bathroom, nice amenities, Nespresso coffee maker...

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Service. Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: chichenuxmal
Reviews.Content: Beautifully converted Palace. Ample, nicely appointed Jr. Suite. Helpfull staff.. and a location that makes visiting Madrid a wonderful experience !

Reviews.Title: “COMFORT IN THE BEST LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: roberta_underwood
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, sylish, very modern in an old building. Breakfast was a feast. The plus point is the location, Plaza del Angel next to Plaza de Santa Ana. All attractions are within 20 minutes walk. The best Tapas are on your doorstep. However the hotel tapas bar was the worst; expensive and the food tasted as if it had been cooked in old fat.Across the street is a good authentic bar where many hours were spent. On Plaza Ana Villa-Rosa has very good flamenco dancing that is nothing like the sort supplied by troups that visit cheaper resorts. This hotel service would make a stay in Madrid perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Unmatched hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vitorspencer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply incredible. Helpful staff, beautiful and extremely comfortable suite, one of the best locations in Madrid... we left the hotel feeling like coming back to it again soon! Another detail: the halways are constantly kept with some fresh scent which was relaxing and very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “no response from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: anniekmcc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a prepaid room for after Xmas break this coming December through their website...our credit card was charged entire amount back in August but no confirmation was ever sent by hotel. I have sent several emails asking them to confirm but never receive any response of any kind. At this point, not sure if we will ever stay there or end up in a fight to get our money back but my impressions already tainted by this absolute lack of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for leisure, not for business”
Reviews.Author: Giovanni141967
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well located. Good breakfast with plenty of choice between salty and sweet stuff. Not the best choice if you like to organise meetings in town as the assistance to the organiser and delegates is quite limited. Rooms are pretty new, but many of them are right on noisy streets. I arrived there late in the night and although I sent them three emails and made a call, I was given a room where it was hard to manage to rest. The hotel was not fully booked, but I was asked a supplement to get a "soundproof" room to sleep 6 hours. And that despite the fact that I have a NH fidelity card. In the morning, after some complaints, they did not charge me the extra supplement.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hellsbells42
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading up on Tripadvisor Stayed in a Superior room for 3 nights. Didnt have any dealings with the staff apart from check in/out so no complaints. Didnt eat at the hotel as plenty of places nearby. Plus points - Superior rooms are on the top floor therefore we rarely heard any noise from the busy square or outside traffic - Hotel was spotless - Fantastic location, easy walking to most sights, plenty of bars & restaurants close by. - Metro stops within a short walk - Room stocked with plenty of amenities, nespresso machine & ipod dock etc also bought our own water and was able to put in the mini bar - Hidden vanity mirror in the dresser - did worry about how i would blow dry my hair until i found this hidden away (as the full length mirror wasnt near a socket) - Loved the exposed beams & my boyfriend enjoyed the gadgetry of the windows & blind!! - Room was cleaned whilst we were out between the hours of 9-3 - didnt even see any cleaning staff & room was spotless. Negatives - Our only gripe was every now and again we had a sewer/drain smell in the room (504), thought it may have been a one off but I think it was something to do with the vents/air con in the room. If it was constant or we were staying longer than a few days I would have complained (it seemed to be when we first woke up or randomly in the early evening) - Also just slightly disappointed in the size of the superior room, we had enough space, spotless and comfortable. Maybe the sloping beamed roof (as fantastic as it was) made it feel smaller than i expected for a superior and took up considerable unused space. Looking back i would have liked to see what the standard room looked like.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AuburnsKai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved staying at this contemporary-decored hotel. The bedding was comfy; the dark-wood floors lent warmth to the room. The staff were genuinely welcoming and accommodating. The hotel is on a comfortably (as opposed to overbearing) lively plaza where one can dine and/or enjoy the (sometimes) live music.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: someone40
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel this is and in a fantastic location right in the middle of everything. You can easily walk to all the tourist hot spots enjoying the sights of Madrid. There are so many bars and cafes within 5 mins walk that you would have to stay for a few years to try them all out. Some with great food at very reasonable prices considering where you are. The reception staff were really great and helpful and the consierge was fantasticlly helpfull in booking restaurants and giving advice. The hotel was very well laid out and spotlessly clean. We stayed in a junior suite that was on two levels with the bedroom upstairs and was a good size with all you could want including tea, coffee and water with a tv in the bedroom as well as in the sitting room. The room was on the side of the hotel so not overlooking the square and had a small balcony. Some comments said there was a lot of noise at night but in our room you would have to strain to hear any as there was a double glazed window with and outside wooden shutter and a full solid wood shutter on the inside. bearing in mind the out side noise level it was very well insulated. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as it was a bit expencive at 25e or 19e if you booked it the day before but had breakfast at some of the thousands of cafes near by. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but needs soundproofing.”
Reviews.Author: HC45
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere centrally located, and this certainly fitted the bill - round the corner from great nightlife and very handy for sightseeing. We had a superior twin room and it was nearly perfect - beautiful decor, nice sitting area and very comfortable. We also liked that it had tea and cofee making facilities in the room (unusual for Spain). BUT we had a real issue with noise - we were on the first floor in a corner room with 3 large windows and the constant traffic noise made it really difficult to sleep. I don't expect a city centre hotel to be completely silent, but I do expect a hotel of this standard to have soundproofing on the windows. This would put me off staying there again, which is a shame, as the hotel was really lovely otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: carltoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend over August Bank Holiday. We booked a superior room which was excellent. Large clean and well appointed. Location was excellent and once the window closed no problem with noise. Staff were uniformly excellent. I don't often like to give one way glowing reviews but can't think of anything bad to say about the place. Well done to all involved there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and smart, modern interiors.”
Reviews.Author: Atticus01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Superior room and had no complaints at all. The hotel appears to have been restored very recently, to a high standard. Staff were smart, helpful and efficient. The beds are of an impressive size, but were a little firm for my personal taste. We enjoyed a first class 60 minute massage that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobwake3
Reviews.Content: What a find.This hotel was located within walking distance of all the important museums and many of the important sights in Madrid.It was across the street from the busy hopping Plaza Santa Ana The hotel is quite new crisp and fresh.The staff was helpful and willing to help.I left my cell phone in our hotel in Seville and the staff arranged to have it sent overnight to Madrid. We had a Jr.suite which was spacious clean and well appointed.We just loved the accommodations.We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel because it was pricey

Reviews.Title: “New, new, new.”
Reviews.Author: Enrique M
Reviews.Content: It has the best location of Madrid, in plaza Santa Ana. The hotel is build in an old palace, with a state of the art construction and decoration. You have the best "tapas" bar in Madrid, created by the world knonw chef Paco Roncero. I higly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very helpful staff, rooms very comfortable but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: EnglishmaninSpain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night during the week during a visit to Madrid with my daughter. We loved the location, where Puerto del Sol, Atorcha Station, the Prado, Thyssen are all within walking distance. The Hotel has been beautifully designed and our room, a Junior suite was a really good size room with very comfortable furnishings etc. Our bathroom was small but adequate and the bathroom fittings were of the highest quality. The reception staff were extremely helpful to book us restaurants and to help us find our way around the city. But sadly the only thing that let the Hotel down was the traffic noise that kept us awake until the early hours. The Hotel really needs some double or triple glazing I can't understand why the didn't install it in the refurbishment- perhaps it was a planning issue. Would recommend a room on one of the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Konigv
Reviews.Content: Location perfect. Central but still had a quiet sleep. Lovely rooms, great bed, shower. Lovely little Juliette balcony. Got a good rate for one night but when asking to stay an additional night they wanted to charge an extra 50 euros a night, so we left

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!”
Reviews.Author: HeyDAVEScotland
Reviews.Content: Just back... Pros - amazing location so close to Sol. Hotel has a fairly good tapas restaurant and bar with outdoor tables. Hotel is very new so it's in good condition. Lobby nice with helpful staff, very clean and good facilities. Had a superior room on 5th with wooden beams. Room immaculate and spacious. Cons - sound insulation between rooms not as good as initially thought. Central Madrid hotel will always be a little noisey. Mojitos sold eveywhere in Spain but always sickly sweet and so was case with hotel restaurant!!!! Room with wooden beams very dark and I suspect a standard may have been preferable. Madrid tips - careful a few pick-pockets, bus tour good and worth a two day pass, great museums and football stadium worth a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Ronald F
Reviews.Content: Quiet room, very good shower and a/c close to plaza mayor and puerta del sol

Reviews.Title: “Wow.go out the door and you are inoldtown”
Reviews.Author: poochienoonan
Reviews.Content: Bought this five star for 125us on price line. Love it! gorgeous. But bag got stolen as I was emptying car. Watch out. Best buy in a long time. Will update with photos later

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: freedom2chill
Reviews.Content: Part of the NH group but has a boutique feel. Very comfortable room, with a spacious bathroom. We came in late on a flight from Barcelona (after walking around all day in Barcelona) and the bed was just too comfortable and as soon as out heads touched the pillow we fell asleep. The area around the hotel is very lively with a bunch of bars, and restaurants with outdoor seating. A little pricey but totally worth it. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: matuk78
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, plenty of bar/restaurant and turist attractions nearby. Modern facilities in a very attractive building, quite good level of service (could be improved). I slept in one of the top floor rooms that I would highly recommend as they are full of character (ie exposed beams). Breakfast good but not cheap (around 28 Euro extra).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff.... Great food....So clean....Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: morvenforres
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel lovely atmosphere would stay here again..Central location... Room was spotless and checked again for you in the early evening..Helpful smiling staff... The in house living room was a big plus if you wanted more space to sit with friends...Breakfast was a real treat also so much choice of fresh fare...We used the Estado Puro restaurant on our last evening the best meal we had in Madrid was in the Estado puro at this hotel....Loved our stay..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: AmitC01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel 4 nights and I really enjoyed my stay. Rooms were big with all the amneties you would expect and more. Staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel has very high standards, everything is new, clean and spotless. Breakfast was great with many fresh fruits (although it lacked fresh vegetables, but still it was more than enough(. The hotel is right over Plaza del Angel and a few meters from Plaza de Santa Ana, a lively place with street shows and many restaurants (we especially loved Lateral). Next door there is Cafe Central with jazz and other shows and generally the atmosphere is very lively and musical. Within 5 minutes of walking you can get to Puerta del Sol and all the shopping area. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline's 5 star in Old/Bourbon Madrid for U.S. $130/night”
Reviews.Author: tamaralea
Reviews.Content: I don't think I'd pay more, as our room was small. We were traveling with our son and had to get two rooms, as the hotel does not have any rollaway beds. A rollaway wouldn't fit, anyway. The doors are very loud when closing. We walked from the Atocha train station. It was about 10 blocks, but all uphill on Calle de Atocha. The streets were not well marked, so watch for a small NH sign on a building on Calle de Atocha. The entrance is around the corner. You must ring the doorbell to enter, as they keep the doors locked. The room was clean and well decorated. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: Bloomie82
Reviews.Content: As everyone said in previous reviews, the location can't be beat. We had a very large room with a staircase that went to a sleeping loft. The king size bed in the loft was extremely comfortable. The stairs are a little steep, so anyone who has concerns about stairs should be careful. My two kids stayed on the pull out couch downstairs. This was not a particularly good mattress, it was pretty standard for a pull out couch. We were hoping for a cot so my kids wouldn't need to share a bed, but the hotel doesn't have them. The bathroom was huge, with two showers and two sinks. Our room was on the second floor facing the square, which was fun for people watching. It wasn't too noisy, but you could hear music until around midnight. The city really gets going at night and it's fun to watch. The rooms were very clean and the staff were great. There is a room behind the check-in desk that has a glass ceiling looking over archeological remains. My kids enjoyed this. We were travelling for two weeks and this was the best hotel we staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and excellent service. Well done NH Palacio!”
Reviews.Author: Witt79
Reviews.Content: As recent visitors to your hotel, we would like to pass on out thanks and appreciation to your staff. The hotel is beautiful and extremely well located near Saint Anna Plaza. When we arrived, having successfully negotiated driving into the centre of Madrid, it was a great relief to be able to rely on the staff to take good care of both us and our car. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any discerning guests.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TBIL
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull hotel in the heart of Madrid. Clean,& very large room wilth all amneties. Super service at front desk. Lazy service during breakfast. Rich and tasty breakfast. Value for money. Highly recommended !!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTO!”
Reviews.Author: Samscatter
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place. Location, staff, hotel, breakfast, bed, quality overall was amazing. I cannot fault this hotel. It is my first stay in Madrid and went to celebrate my boyfriend’s birthday. I had previously booked into the H10 Villa de Reina, until I read a review to say that it’s currently having outside maintenance and is covered in scaffolding and sheeting. I quickly cancelled and rebooked into the Palacio de Tepa. The staff were attentive, helpful and spoke excellent English. I asked for a spacious room overlooking the square with a balcony and that is exactly what I got. If you do go to this hotel, try room 406, it is a perfect location (a 5 minute walk from Sol) and has triple aspect with balconies, all very modern and still felt classically Spanish at the same time. As for the bed, well it was huge and very comfortable. The breakfast was plentiful and special. A huge range of fruits, pastries, sliced meats/cheeses, sandwiches, cereals, toasts etc and you could also order a hot breakfast like omelette or I had the Spanish omelette which was fabulous! Also there is cava on ice so I made buck fizz with my breakfast too! The only down side is that we didn't stay long enough! All in all a wonderful experience and came back thoroughly relaxed. Big thanks to the Palacio de Tepa, we hope to see you again!

Reviews.Title: “balcony to the joyful street”
Reviews.Author: akliselim
Reviews.Content: I think this will be one of the best hotels in Madrid soon. I say "will be" because the hotel was opened last October, and you still smell the new paint in the room. I think it will be gone by the end of the summer. I don't know why odourless water based paints do not become the industry standard, also for wood; they are as durable. This is especially important in hotels, because they tend to keep the windows of all unused rooms tightly closed for hygiene reasons. Anyway, this is not a problem specific to this hotel, but common to all new hotels, sometimes even to older ones with bad material (paint, varnish, or carpet) selection. Staying in the room, it was also not an option to leave the windows open for ventilation at night, because it is quite noisy outside. There are a few rooms at the interior courtyard or under the roof, but balcony to one of the most joyful squares in Madrid is what contributes to the charm of staying here, so I would recommend a room with a balcony, in spite of all. The location is just marvelous! Most museums are within minutes; many good restaurants, tapas bars are in the surrounding. One of the best live music clubs next door, the other just next block straight ahead. The superior room at the corner was comfortably spacious, the standard rooms also reasonably wide; all with a simple but beautiful elegance. We had no major complaints about cleanliness, but I must say the cleaning lady was far too hasty as if pressed for time; this is especially a handicap as the dark wood floors show every particle of dust. The rest of the staff was very professional as experienced in most NH hotels. The breakfast was excellent, not giving a feeling of abundance, but of quality and good choice. When we return to Madrid, I don’t think we would bother to look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location , minuscule bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: NealM
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of it's central location. We paid 115euro per night for a king room. When we checked in we were told that we could not have a king room as booked and had to settle for 2 twin beds pushed together... Which was annoying. The rooms were pleasant enough but bathrooms were not big enough to swing a rat ... Really tiny. Location is awesome however we quickly discovered that Madrid is a small city and easy to walk around so you maybe able to get cheaper hotels a little further out. Hotel bar is pricey and intriguingly bedecked in hundreds of small red plastic flamenco dolls... The kind of thing you buy as a tat souvenir...I think they were trying to be cool but frankly it just looks naff and cheap....with hints of freaky scariness. Concierge was very helpful and whilst the hotel is stylish it is devoid of atmosphere ...but then for a city break you just want somewhere clean, tidy and in a good spot...and on this agenda the hotel scores well.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, great location”
Reviews.Author: samueldg
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised, having used nh before, was prepared for the same ammenities decoration etc... But it was completely new! The best; bulgari ammenties in the room and great bathrobes! Not a stuffy five star, more up beat, homely and cozy. Made you feel at home. The tapas bar and staff are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Brian_SF
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on priceline, and for the price, it was a good value. The location really can't be beat. You are within a fifteen minute walk from the Prado and the Reina Sofia art museums, and about the same to the Royal Palace. And if you are into feeling the pulse of the city, you are also really close to the Puerta Del Sol plaza. I was there during the big rallies going on there, so that was definitely worth a stroll. As for the room itself, well, it was small. The bed took up most of the room, but there was also a small desk right beneath the TV that you could have done a bit of work on I suppose. The bathroom was pretty small, but well equipped, with nice fixtures. Considering I was alone, it wasn't bad. You might get a bit sick of your travel partner if sharing, though. I had a room on the 5th floor, which I think is the top, looking out onto what I think was a skylight from the restaurant. Not much of a view, but it was more quiet than a room that looked out onto the street. But to be honest, I didn't really feel the street was crazy loud or anything, just a typical urban street. Cars only go in one direction around there, so there isn't a lot of honking. I would stay here again if I got a good rate. The wifi was free, and the service polite if not outstanding. If you're looking for a convenient option on a quick trip to Madrid, you should at least consider this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in central Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Bluenoser80
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the NH Palacio de Tepa for four nights in June 2011. This NH hotel is very new (less than a year old) and it certainly had the feeling of a top notch hotel. The hotel and our room itself were impeccably clean. We had a room on the top floor (the 5th floor). It was very large with exposed wood beams. There was a ton of closet space for unpacking our clothes. The room looked out on a sort of courtyard so it was very quiet. The service from the cleaning staff is to be noted as our room was checked twice daily and was always in spotless condition. One issue we did have with our room was the hot water (or lack thereof). Showering between 8 and 9 proved challenging as we found there to be very little hotel water during this time (which is too bad as the shower was very nice). Perhaps because the hotel primarily serves business travelers too many people are showering at this time. The hotel needs to address this issue. Another issue with our room was that the towel warmer did not function. Perhaps a kink considering the newness of the hotel, but still something that needs to be fixed. The hotel has very good free high-speed wireless. The location of the hotel is absolutely fantastic for tourists. Nearly everything you want to see (e.g., Museo del Prado, Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor, etc...) is within walking distance. The metro in Madrid is also cheap and efficient and the "Anton Martin" metro stop is 200 meters from the hotel, so that too is an option for getting around. There are many good places to eat and shop near the hotel as well. We generally like to walk everywhere when we travel and the central location of this hotel definitely made that possible for us. We would highly recommend this hotel to others. It is a 5-star hotel, and while it may not be on par with the Ritz and some other leading 5-star brands, it certainly met our expectations and provided good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: msdillo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a busy square. If you are looking for lots of noise, restaurants, etc. close by, this is a good location for you. It is within a 15 minute walk of the Prado. Our travel agent booked us into a "superior" room. This room was on the top floor and was very small, much smaller than a room in most motels in the US. The bathroom was the size you would get in a Days Inn. There was no window - just a large skylight in the angled roof, so seeing out wasn't really possible. We went back to reception and asked to be upgraded to a junior suite. Luckily they had one (only 25E more per day) and we requested to be on the interior courtyard so that all the noise from the square wouldn't bother us. They put us in a very nice suite that was about 3 times as big as the original room. This hotel has free WiFi and was the only one on our 3 week trip that had a coffee maker in the room (expresso). The breakfast was fine but they really don't have a restaurant - just a bar that opens around noon with tapas. Since our trip was a package deal, I'm not sure what these rooms go for - it may have been a good value for the money. But the gracious service we received elsewhere was missing and it just didn't rise to the 4 star level.

Reviews.Title: “And again.... location, location”
Reviews.Author: ElisabetNetherlands
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five day visit to Madrid, we stayed at the Palacio de Tepa... The hotel has a wonderful location, right in the hustle and bustle of " the real "Madrid. A stone's throw away from fine tapasbars and lively little squares where you could sit around all day ! It is a short stroll to that splendid Prado museum and shopping is just around the corner... The Palacio is beautifully restored with respect to older features.... Good clean rooms, housekeeping excellent, breakfast very good.... friendly people... although it surprises me again that few people speak a second language. !

Reviews.Title: “Madrid's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravel20
Reviews.Content: Palacio de Tepa is such a find and its website really doesn't do it justice at all. This is a very reasonably priced, modern hotel in a sympathetically restored palace. As it only opened in October 2010 everything is super clean and new. The staff are amazing, really friendly and helpful and the rooms are well appointed with great connectivity for electrical/IT equipment, marble bathrooms, very comfortable beds, free fast wifi and quiet rooms. The choice at breakfast is enormous - there's not much they didn't have and well presented. Smoked salmon scrambled eggs or eggs however you want are all on offer. Last night they upgraded me to one of the deluxe rooms on the top floor beneath the eaves - absolutely stunning... This is a great hotel for either business or pleasure. Will definitely be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kelobie
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here last night on business, best value for money for a 5* in Madrid. Perfect central location in a nice and happening part of town (next to Plaza Santa Ana) and within walking distance to many landmarks and tourist attractions. Found a live music bar nearby and there are lots of cafes, pubs and Spanish restaurants in the area. The hotel itself perhaps was a palace as the name suggests, and compared to many NH hotels in Madrid this is probably one of the best. Discrete with understated elegance, not as grand as properties like the Westin Palace, but more like the Park Hyatt style. I had a top floor attic type room with a small window so it was a little dark for me to catch up with work, but otherwise it has a lot of characters and serve well for leisure travellers. Free wifi for 12 hours. Breakfast was lovely too.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but no five stars”
Reviews.Author: Alexjamessabbymia
Reviews.Content: Its a good hotel, new, clean and well located. But its no luxurios or hip . No spa inside hotel, no bar inside. Rooms r great but u cant regulate airconditioned so it was only hot air or nothing. If u open windows its very noisy.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Palacio de Tepa
HotelInfo.Address: San Sebastian 2, 28012 Madrid, Spain
